Articles.Content:
17 minutes ago, Theysen said:

TBF I didn't read any information if it is priced at all or am I blind?

 

EDIT: CONFIRMED BLIND, it costs money  Now I go in a corner and laugh

It's paid but that can be anywhere from 99 cent to 30 euro.

 

EU4 expansions go from 2 to 20 and and with the price of the base game I reckon it's closer to the 2

 

8 minutes ago, Noobton said:

Any chance we can get a model similar to Paradox's where if you want to skip a mod you can still get bug fixes and some improvements?

They are a mean lean DLC making machine, but I still love their model, and it will help keep the modding community somewhat united.

 

I also love the paradox model as it doesn't force you to buy but still has enough locked off content to make you want it most of the time. You can pick and choose extra content based on your preferences. This could also mean that the KSP devs could widen the game's scope.

Edited March 17, 2017 by Spartwo
Looking forward to the new content!  I am definitely willing to pay for DLC since I have been getting it free for years.  After all, the devs have to eat, right?

I myself am hoping they take some lessons from the Paradox model, especially with regards to cities skylines.


CS After Dark added the day night cycle into the base game for free, but offered a way to pay to enrich it with night life and taxis and such

On 3/17/2017 at 12:30 PM, Woodstar said:

Why april, why not just 2013, Kinda makes me mad, made my purchase Dec. 2013.

They announced there would eventually be DLC and people threw up a fuss, so for a short time up until the end of April anyone who bought the game before then would not have to pay for it.

Edited March 20, 2018 by Spartwo

I like how the DLC is not so much new functionality but a set of pre-made challenges.

While I have no doubt someone *could* recreate those missions in a free mission-pack, there is not much incentive to do so, as they could just as easily make other missions instead(and have more users)

Is mission builder in 1.2.9, or is it expected to wait for 1.3?

Has 1.2.9 been released yet?

So, it's contract configurator with a UI?

With this:

 

And the soviet parts pack?

I guess just a personal parachute for kerbals worth few backs! I am really happy that squad finally decided to go for dlc model. It should encourage devs to think about new features and develop them on the high level

2 minutes ago, Sonny_Jim said:

So, it's contract configurator with a UI?

With this:

 

And the soviet parts pack?

I would say that given the lengths they went to not to use the word contract, and some of the other things they mentioned, that this seems more likely to be something that adds in more of a 'scenario editor" like what rollercoaster tycoon has, and a way to share scenarios you make, and as such would build itself into the existing Scenario option in the main menu.

[SPECULATION]

the thing I would pay over 20$ is a well made environmental pack.

clouds/winds/ precipitations/ turbulances/etc

but kinda fps frendly and well optimized

2 minutes ago, Mad_Scientist said:

I guess just a personal parachute for kerbals worth few backs! I am really happy that squad finally decided to go for dlc model. It should encourage devs to think about new features and develop them on the high level

That's been a mod for, like, 3-4 years, dude.

7 minutes ago, DarthVader said:

Paid expansion except for those who bought the game before April 2013?

http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/post/47730955705/expansions-dlc-and-the-future-of-ksp

Yup, I'm very glad I bought before that date and will get my promised, free DLCs forever.

1 minute ago, Majorjim! said:

Yup, I'm very glad I bought before that date and will get my promised, free DLCs forever.

Assuming they hold to it, which they still havent responded on and conveniently left completely out of the announcement.

This is great news and hopefully shows KSP will be continued to be developed for years to come. Not so much here but on Facebook and twitter I have noticed a few people moaning about paid DLC. What people need to realise is it's not the crap DLC you tend to see from games now-a-days with £5 colour scheme packs, but a proper expansion. KSP is a business at the end of the day and if people want continued development they will have to support it in other ways. This has always been the case for lots of games with a long lifetime of continued development.

11 minutes ago, Rokker said:

Assuming they hold to it, which they still havent responded on and conveniently left completely out of the announcement.

Since there is a large intersection between the gamer community and the human scum pool, there'll be enough people who say "well, I bought the game having been promised this in a legally binding manner, so I'mma kick up a excrementsstorm and demand a refund". This could easily spur the easily lead people into doing the same, which could easily bankrupt the company. I'mma guess they'll just give it for free to those of us who've had the game that long to save the hassle of dealing with the amazing person gamers.

Edited March 17, 2017 by CuAnnan
pedantic correction required

Just now, Rokker said:

Assuming they hold to it, which they still havent responded on and conveniently left completely out of the announcement.

I am sharpening my pitchfork as a write this.

 Joking aside, the promise was made, and factored heavily into my decision making to buy at the time.  @SQUAD care to comment?

Edited March 17, 2017 by Majorjim!

2 minutes ago, CuAnnan said:

Since there is a large intersection between the gamer community and the human scum pool, there'll be enough people who say "well, I bought the game having been promised this in a legally binding manner, so I'mma kick up a excrementsstorm and demand a refund". This could easily spur the easily lead people into doing the same, which could easily bankrupt the company. I'mma guess they'll just give it to those of us who've had the game that long for free to save the hassle of dealing with the amazing person gamers.

I dunno about you but I never had the game "for free". I paid for it with money.

I'm interested to see if they'll version bump the game for free, which would include any bugfixes, and just make the new content unlockable through the paid DLC. Hate to sound cheap but I don't feel like I should pay for fixes to problems in a game I already bought. I've donated well over $100 to modders the past 2 years for my content

Edited March 17, 2017 by Drew Kerman

1 minute ago, Rokker said:

I dunno about you but I never had the game "for free". I paid for it with money.

They'll give it for free for those fo us who've had the game for that long.

English is my second language. But thanks for pointing out the ambiguity. It doesn't at all make you one of those gamers. Nope nope nope.

1 hour ago, DarthVader said:

Paid expansion except for those who bought the game before April 2013?

http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/post/47730955705/expansions-dlc-and-the-future-of-ksp

Yes we will keep our promise
Well, I don't particularly care that much for the historic missions, but the Mission Builders seems to be the gameplay feature career always lacked.

Just now, Badie said:

Yes we will keep our promise 

Good people. Cheers Badie for the confirmation.

Edited March 17, 2017 by Majorjim!

26 minutes ago, Sonny_Jim said:

With this:

 

So, with DLC Kerbals can take two parachutes: main and backup, Vanguard and Squad. Game gets more realistic.

Excellent news! To keep KSP alive, Squad needs to make money and DLC is the way to go.

And people balking at paying $20 for the DLC, just think in terms of hours of entertainment per dollar spent. You pay now $10 for 2 hours of movies...

I, for one, am thrilled!  This is what I call a big announcement!  And I have no problem shelling out a few bucks for it, considering how much I've gotten out of it already. KSP gives me something to do, and write about, day after day, instead of sitting home on disability, bored out of my skull.... And they've given us so much free stuff already... Take my $$$.  I will gladly pay for the next expansion.  

In fact.... I'd throw Squad 5 bucks right now just for that little parachute.... 

Edited March 17, 2017 by Just Jim

Good thing i bought it in March 2013

But i wonder how this will affect the modding community, i hope the fragmentation from dlcs wont hinder most mods...
